name: Paroxysmal Nocturnal Hemoglobinuria (PNH) with Thrombotic Microangiopathy
chief_complaint: I've been feeling extremely tired, and my urine is dark in the morning
treatment: bone marrow transplant in refractory cases
prognosis: Variable; improved with eculizumab but risk of thrombosis remains. 10-year survival ~65% with treatment
description: A rare, acquired hematopoietic stem cell disorder causing complement-mediated hemolysis, thrombosis, and bone marrow failure. The thrombotic microangiopathy variant presents with additional renal complications due to small vessel thrombosis.
multiple_choice: Paroxysmal Nocturnal Hemoglobinuria (PNH) with Thrombotic Microangiopathy
